website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line pogo stick by the company that has been making them since 1918. Though it takes some users a break-in period, it's one of the best available on the market.
pros: Built for users age 9 and older up to 160 lbs
Foam covering on handles and frame for added grip and protection
cons: Best suited for those who have mastered pogo stick jumping
Not the best pick for small kids

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pogo stick!
customer_reviews.text: These work well for lower range pricing of pogo sticks. I teach elementary PE and I have several of these models for my older elementary student's (even as low as 2nd graders who are more experienced use them). These compared to the lower weight version provide more bounce for more advanced kids or my heavier kids. I'm 6' 0" and 180 lbs. and these actually allow me to demonstrate (with minimal bottoming out). I've had advanced students weighing as little as 60 lbs. using these pogo sticks just fine and they can actually sky fairly high (a foot high or so :) ).
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Man that hurts!
customer_reviews.text: There is a hard piece of plastic under the handles on the main portion of the pogo stick that my son kept bumping into and scraping on. This was not his first pogo stick. In fact, he had a smaller version of the same brand that was awesome. They put foam on some parts but not the part that bangs against the jumpers body. Poor design feature. Unfortunately he does not use it much because it hurts to use. He loved his old one and we couldn't get him off it. Bounces great though and right size for his age.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Solid and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2.0 version which is more sturdy and solid than the previous one. It can carry the weight of a man adult and bounce forever without breaking. HOWEVER, it is not bouncy enough for the little ones because of its solid components. So for an 9 year old and younger get the first generation for easier bounce. For big or heavy kids get this one. Lastly, don’t get the grey color one. It really looks like a medical device.
customer_reviews.author: Private Party

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! I just gave this to my granddaughter for her birthday yesterday and she loved it. The construction of the item is top notch, and was as described. When purchasing read the product description and go by the weight limit, rather than the age. My granddaughter is tall and solidly built for her age. If I had purchased the one for her age group it would have been too small or potentially would have received less use for a lesser amount of time. I went by weight and the one I purchased will last her for years.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Tevis

customer_reviews.title: Fun and tough
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 2 years and my son still likes it. Pros: Works well, has held up to kid usage, fun to use. Cons: My son likes the "Maverick" version better because the middle part is smaller so his legs don't hit it.
customer_reviews.author: jeb

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The height requirement is the most important thing but somehow I had to dig through everything to find any info about the pogos size. I only weigh 120 lbs but this is not meant for anyone over 50” tall. Not only was it too short, my entire legs are bruised and it is painful from where the pogo hits the knee and lower leg area. I wouldn’t purchase this for any child bc of the bruising and no adult can actually use this despite being well under the height requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Jaye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pogo stick!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pogo stick. My 8 year old (70 pound) son received it for Christmas and was bouncing without any issue. This is his second Flybar pogo stick - he outgrew the smaller model. The spring is stiff, but if you are good at, and familiar with pogo sticking, you shouldn't have any problem. He loved how much higher he could get! Only trouble with him being on the smaller side of the size requirements is he's not tall enough to bounce hands free like he could on the smaller stick. But time will take care of that :)
customer_reviews.author: Modigliani

customer_reviews.title: Brought me back to my younger years
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter is 9 and she is afraid to use it. Bit it is very nice. Sturdy and holds your body well. My husband even had a shot at it and liked
customer_reviews.author: ShannonTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Plastic pieces defect
customer_reviews.text: We just received this today and my son has used it for 15 minutes. Although there is foam on the bottom and top part of the pogo stick, there isn’t any in the middle where my son’s knees are. That area has two plastic pieces with a seam that have cut and scratched the inside of his knees. He is an average height 11 year-old. So this is probably not a product a boy of his height should have. The plastic should be covered. I think this is a defect on the manufacturers part that should be looked into. I am unable to upload the pics of the plastic pieces and cuts as there isn’t an add photo icon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: K who is 10 has really enjoyed his pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: K who is 10 has really enjoyed his pogo stick. It was something that he asked for and I am so glad I found one for him. It is very shiny and beautiful and holds his weight really well as he is a big 10 year old. This has been at least 30 minutes to an hour worth of fun a day. It was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Fallen Over Book Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Peter Pan syndrome
customer_reviews.text: Sure, I’m an old lady (42) but I can still pogo with no hands and jump rope at the same time... really, I’m not kidding! This thing reminds me of being a kid ... except for when we had to fight the dinosaurs, but that’s a story for another time. If it works for my old self, it will work for your wild children.
customer_reviews.author: Tara G

customer_reviews.title: Spring is too heavy duty for light person
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to receive this pogo stick, however I am too light to make it work. The description of the product states a weight range of 80 to 160 pounds. I weigh 95 pounds and could not bounce because the spring is way too stiff for a weakling such as I. Luckily, a coworker tried and liked it and now he's hooked and purchased the stick from me. I have ordered another stick in a lighter weight class.
customer_reviews.author: Elle V

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old daughter really wanted a pogo stick. Her school has some and she uses them at recess all the time and wanted to buy one of her own. We bought a Flybar Maverick pogo stick first, since she claims to use it at school, but it was small and we did not think it would last very long. We bought the Master stick and it worked wonderfully! My daughter weighs 85 pounds and is at the very bottom of the weight limit, but she could still bounce on it. One think did concern us, the stick makes a peculiar squeaking noise that is a little concerning. We thought it might effect the quality of the stick.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Z

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Quality in Handlebars
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick is awesome for my 9 year old. It took him a couple days to break in because the spring is super tight, but the picture I took shows the wear on the handlebars after 5 days of use. Seriously. And he was only on it for about 10 minutes a day. I’ve contacted the seller to see what can be done, but I’m really disappointed in the flimsy quality of the handlebars material. It’s just a thin foam and the metal ends before the foam does, so of course the foam is going to give in. I’m very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: 2 years after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I only write reviews after I have owned for some time. This Pogo Stick has now been owned for 2-3 years and is still working extremely well! And let me tell you, my kids are not good at taking care of things, so for it still to working as expected years later 5 stars all day long!
customer_reviews.author: Garyfolk

customer_reviews.title: SUPER  SAM
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT FOR A KID IN THE NEIGHBOR HOOD THAT DONT HAVE AND DIDNT GET NOTHING FOR CHRISTMAS.MOST IMPORTANT HE WAS VERY HAPPY AND GRATEFUL.SO HE WAS HAPPY/AND I WAS ASWELL/HE LOVES IT.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yo son really wanted a pogo stick but he's a small kid and lightweight (about 85 lbs at the time). I was really worried about the stiffness of the larger weight sticks but the flimsiness of the small ones. Since he had actually tried a larger stiffer one and didn't like it; I had a decision to make. Well, I'm glad I bought this one. It is great! I bounce on it myself (185 lbs) and he has no problem either. Feels durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: Best gift purchase in years
customer_reviews.text: The pogo stick was a GREAT choice. My son is at this awkward tween stage, we struggle to find gifts that not related to screen time, and he'll will use more than once. This pogo was perfect. Great for some exercise and it's fun! He uses it several times a day. He literally pogo-ed so much one of the internal pins broke. If you have a child who uses the pogo daily, this may happen to you too. Luckily, the sellers are fantastic, and promptly helped me with a replacement. Not only would I recommend this to a friend, I'll be purchasing for my friends 12/yr daughter.
customer_reviews.author: RaShell

customer_reviews.title: 88 lbs is good.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find real world weight reviews. I was worried that up to 160lbs was too strong of spring for him. My son is 88lbs and it is good for his weight. At 88lbs he doesn't bottom out and gets good rebound. Less than 24 hrs he jumped 100 straight a week later non stop till he is tired. We had a old (cheap) pogo that was too strong of spring for him and purchased this one. Now that he learned how to pogo he went to our old one just to try it and he said it is way more work to keep bouncing. He should be good on this one for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for or kids knowing we were going to be stuck home for a long time. Once we received it the kids had a rough few days trying to get the idea. They became pro jumpers. Then it started to fall apart. First, the shoe keeps falling off. It fits back together but it could be dangerous if it falls off on impact. Then the name brand cap that covers the top of the spring broke. The company sent a replacement and I sent the old one back. The replacement spring cover broke on day one. If my kids didn't like it soo much, I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... pogo stick for my kids to share and they loved it so much I thought I would buy another ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pogo stick for my kids to share and they loved it so much I thought I would buy another with a higher weight limit since they are growing. My kids do not like this pogo stick because the thicker middle section hits their knees as they bounce, and it hurts. The single center shaft is their favorite pogo stick. I would send this model back but my kids have used it in an attempt to like it, but they don't.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality with one exception
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good quality pogo stick. There is one plastic piece just below the handles that broke the very first time my daughter tried it and dropped the stick on the driveway. BUT, a quick phone call to customer service and they apologized and mailed a new part to us immediately. Got it in a few days and it hasn't broken since. So, awesome customer service.
customer_reviews.author: JimfromMichigan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 11 year old grandson. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old grandson. He is not ever a complainer! But he has complained that the foam irritates the inside of his legs even with pants on. I think the post is too wide for the foot holders. I wish I had bought one with just a straight post.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: 12 year old GrandSon enjoyed it immensely
customer_reviews.text: 12 year old GrandSon enjoyed it immensely, but it wore out in less than 10 months. He did NOT abuse it, only jumped on level surfaces, but I guess things just aren't made as well as they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Storter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Trendsetting Gift
customer_reviews.text: We were dismayed when our tween daughter asked for a pogo stick for Christmas. I ordered this wondering if it would ever be used or just collect dust in the garage. ONG! The bouncing hasn’t stopped all month! Every kid on the block is in love with this thing. Pogo sticks are now popping up at every home in the neighborhood. This is easy to use and sturdy. I love that my kids are getting a great core workout while having a blast. Don’t think about it. Buy this thing today!
customer_reviews.author: tonya freeman

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this Pogo Stick
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this at the beginning of the pandemic for our grandkids, and they love it. The 10-year boy especially has lots of fun and quickly learned to jump 100 times nonstop. It has been a good activity for them, so I am glad to have bought it for them. It is a good quality product that I would recommend to anyone thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: acmarna

customer_reviews.title: Best for much heavier users.
customer_reviews.text: Our middle son received the maverick pogo stick for Christmas and our older son (10), fell in love. The maverick, however, appeared too small, so I ordered the flybar. Bad idea. The spring is much too tight. I 170 lbs and I can use the flybar without the spring fully compressing. It's tight. That being said, my oldest has finally made it work but we went ahead and ordered him a maverick. Even though he is at the top end of the Maverick's weight limit, he has much more fun on the smaller stick.
customer_reviews.author: BNB1975

customer_reviews.title: Fun but risky gift.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product, my son is 12 and about 100lbs and uses this product frequently. It's held up to the use, only problem I can see is the rubber bottom is wearing down and will expose the metal material underneath, creating a slick surface. Landing at an angle after a bounce could result in an injury, just my take on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the user is weighs enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality pogo stick however the shocks on it are so tight that it was impossible for our kids, who were at the low end of the weight recommendation, to make it work. It's now sitting in the garage, still boxed, as they're unable to use it.
customer_reviews.author: flwrks

customer_reviews.title: It pogos, but isn't very well made
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to, but it isn't very durable. There's a lot of brittle plastic around the pole, and early on, the pogo stick slammed into the sidewalk and the plastic housing shattered. It still works, but not so great that the housing is gone. A bit of a design fail on a product that's likely to crash to the concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Ireviewedit

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 12 yr old son for Christmas. He has loved it. Its spring works well for the weights its intended for. It is hard for my younger and smaller children to use it. At first he did get bruises from his knees hitting the top part of the spring casing. But as he has learned to control the Pogo stick better that has stopped being a problem. It is a well built item and will hopefully last for hours of bouncing.
customer_reviews.author: fogo

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. My 12 year old has been pogoing since ...
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT get this at a discount for a review, but the discount reviews are right. This thing is amazing. My 12 year old has been pogoing since he was 6 years old with cheaper Flybar sticks (Mavericks, usually, and they usually got stolen, uggh), but he needed an upgrade, since he's almost grown now, and WOW, is this an upgrade! If you have a kid/preteen/teen over 110 lbs but under 200 lbs who wants to pogo, this is IT.
customer_reviews.author: Zinnea

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our ten year old son and it has been a hit! He loves it. He's 4'11"/70lbs and it's a great fit for him. He picked up on it very quickly and had less spills in the learning process than you might expect. Practiced near the grass, but never even fell. Get your kiddos moving, this is a great way to do that!
customer_reviews.author: EmilyA

customer_reviews.title: Lacks production quality
customer_reviews.text: The grips do not fit on the handlebars properly, they hang off the edge creating a stress riser/tearing point where the handlebar ends and the grip hangs off. Poor quality control on such a seemingly simple design. We got the 2.0 "redesigned" model too. Maybe good for a single summer of use....
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not very good quality
customer_reviews.text: The plastic cover that hides the mechanism that goes up and down fell off the first day. Without that cover it pinches and scrapes my sons legs so he will not use it. The foam on the handles pealed of in the first week. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie B.

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it! Great work out
customer_reviews.text: I have a 8 year old son that is 65lbs and a 9 years old daughter that is 80lbs. I bought 2 different flybar pogo sticks. The 40-80lbs maverick pogo stick is perfect for my 9yr old son. He tried the 80lbs-160lbs master pogo stick and he can jump on it but the jumps are so stiff because he is not heavy enough. He loves the maverick pogo. My daughter is perfectly fine on the master pogo stick that is 80lbs to 160 lbs she is a little big for the other one.
customer_reviews.author: SilvaG

customer_reviews.title: Super stiff!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We do not care for this pogo stick. Tried couple times now still in box. Maybe you need to use it to loosen it up some but it’s so incredibly hard and stiff to jump. The springs take maybe 80-100 lbs to even try and jump. My son has never pogo’ed before... with trying to learn+super stiff springs ... he can’t even use it. He’s 9. Would’ve returned, trying to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: 2Blessed2Boys

customer_reviews.title: Last stop for aspiring Enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: My son is tall for his age, 78lbs, and is extremely satisfied with his Flybar choice! He picked this out & added it to my cart, he has been earning his own money & saving up, but when I saw how excited he was I ordered it as his birthday gift! Glad I ordered early! As it arrived damaged in handling. But in 8 business days I received the replacement completely padded & unharmed, two thumbs up to sender. He got to try it out finally & mastered no hands by the end of the night! He's excited to grow with his new Flybar pogo stick! Durable, high quality, just the right amount of springy. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Good Times!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 and 10 year old were up and running on these in a matter of hours having the time of their lives! Their cousins came over and loved them, I bought two more for them. My kids are bouncing several hundred hops at a time! It is great exercise and outdoor entertainment them!
customer_reviews.author: DanJ

customer_reviews.title: Too Stiff
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter and had to return it. She is of the age/weight recommended and she couldn't get it to move. The spring was beyond stiff and it felt dangerous for to to keep jumping on it when it wasn't doing what it was suppose to do. Had to return it. I won't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 13-year-old just got this for his birthday and he loves it! He's very into mountain biking and skiing and doing crazy stunts everywhere he goes, so this is something new for him to experiment with! Very sturdy, good bounce, perfect tension for his weight (around 100 lbs)... we are very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A terrible design and that’s disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: We are Flybar fans but this design is bad. The plastic at the top of the spring the springs hits the inside of your knees. My grandson has serious bruises because of it. Not sure how this thing gets any positive reviews. I’d stay away until they redesign it.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Extremely stiff spring
customer_reviews.text: Though it is very sturdy and durable, it is extremely stiff. The spring is just way too hard for an 80 pound child and it doesn't offer much bounce because of this. My husband and I have tried to "break it in" for our daughter, and it hasn't helped much. Anyone less than 125 lbs is probably too light for it and won't make it move that much. My husband weighs about 180 and he has a tough time with it. My daughter is so disappointed. We're going to have to order a new one that is for younger kids because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Londa V

customer_reviews.title: My niece requested this particular pogo stick (age 13)
customer_reviews.text: When my niece received this gift from me she and her siblings immediately went outside to try it out (even though it was dark). I was visiting a couple of weeks later and the pogo stick was outside leaning against the house, obviously be used by niece and her sibs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Petrosky

customer_reviews.title: Has a good bounce!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It can bounce really high compared to my old pogo stick. I like the height because it is taller than the usual pogo stick (Can fit taller people). It is nice that there is a cover over the springs, and textures feet grips. It also comes in a variety of colors to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and bouncy. I like the rubber foot which allows my son to ride it indoors without destroying the floor tiles. What I don't like is that the foam grips rotate freely around the steel frame handles, this does not help with control and balance.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Collins

customer_reviews.title: Not Confident It Will Last Long
customer_reviews.text: This arrived with a broken plastic housing/frame, so we returned it. In looking at the housing, I didn’t get the impression that it would have held up very long anyway. A fall or two, or just a kid dropping it on the ground under normal wear and tear seemed like it would have caused the housing/frame to break easily anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Dion L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun pogo stick for even a130lb person. Great response and lots of fun inside and out. The only issue with ours is it lists to the right while jumping throwing you off balance. Probably just a funny glitch. We’ll return/exchange because it is fun to use. Check it out. You’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is really well made. We got it for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really well made. We got it for my 65 lb. 7 year old boy and my 85 lb. 10 year old girl loves it too. I think the heavier duty one is the way to go because the spring gets bouncier the more they use it. They play outside for an hour or more on this thing and are sore the next day from the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Chariton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Well Built Pogo Stick
customer_reviews.text: Well built pogo stick! Christmas gift for our 12 year old son this past Christmas. He’s enjoyed playing with it and is actually fairly good at it. These came out when I was a kid and could never get the hang of it but he’s bouncing away. Terrific pogo stick, do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mandj28x2

customer_reviews.title: Do it! So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old daughter, 88lbs. She loves it! It’s sturdy but still allows her to bounce easily. She has spent hours on it then it gets handed to the neighborhood kids (is working perfectly for 10-17 y/o kids) and it’s still going strong. It has accidentally been left outside in the rain and still works perfectly but of course I would recommend not making a habit of leaving it out. Overall this has been super fun, safe, and a reliable source of entertainment for all the neighborhood kids! Its so great I even bought a second one so more kids can play together!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Kids liked it
customer_reviews.text: They said it was much better than their previous one. They jumped and had some tricks and hands-free, show-off moments and seemed to have fun.... .....until they went back to their phones and what not. I tried to get them off the devices... It worked for a while....Sigh.....Will keep trying. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pogo stick!!
customer_reviews.text: My 72 lb 9 year old granddaughter loves her pogo stick and so does her 14 year old brother! They had a lightweight one before and said they would “bottom out” hitting the ground on it. They said they’ve never jumped as high as they do on this one. Great product!!!! Very very stiff on first bounce. Lubricant is definitely needed at the top (per instructions!).
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Albee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for light-weight adults!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item after reading all the reviews, and after having returned another Flybar (very heavy duty) one. This one is perfect! It is heavy-duty enough for me to be impressed with the quality, and the adults in my family, who range from 100 to 140 lbs, can effectively bounce on it with just the right tension! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: DANDT

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, bouncy!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I needed a larger pogo for my 12 year old as he outgrew his old one. I’m so glad I didn’t spend $100+ on similar pogo sticks. He says it bounces higher and feels sturdier. #momwin
customer_reviews.author: Candice L

customer_reviews.title: It's hard and it already came broken
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old, right out of the box it had a cut on the handle, I didn't try to claim it and let the time pass so that's on me, he tries to jump in it and can get a few jumps but like others have said, it's too hard, I just hope that with time he will loosen it, he was so exited for it, very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: El Lobo

customer_reviews.title: It holds up well
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it. I had to hop on it a few times to get it going, but after that it has been a huge hit with the kids. The Pogo stick gets dropped in the driveway, hit into fences, the garage, etc. It takes a beating but keeps on working and holds up well. We have had it for 3 months and its still working like new.
customer_reviews.author: H. F.

customer_reviews.title: Rubs against my 9 year olds legs
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for his birthday because his other one broke. He loved his other one but has had it for a while. I was so excited to get him a new one. It came within the estimated time. However, how the pogo stick is built it rubs against his legs. he is 9 years old. Also, it is really hard for him to use. I think as he uses it more it will not be so stiff, that is if he continues to use it with it rubbing his legs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: My 22 year old grandson absolutely loved this pogo stick for Christmas this year
customer_reviews.text: My 22 year old grandson absolutely loved this pogo stick for Christmas this year. He is skinny, maybe 135 lbs, so not sure how much more weight it would take, but for him it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Helander

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a GREAT pogo stick. My daughter isn't quite heavy enough to fully utilize it (the spring is quite strong), but after 4 or 5 bounces the spring begins to engage. I would suggest a minimum weight of 80 to 90 pounds for optimal "bounce". The quality of the product is top notch, I like how easy it is to grease the spring, and the general material feels strong and well made. In a world of foreign junk, it's nice to have a company that still makes high quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: look nice!!
customer_reviews.text: had to return it, my 10 years old "2nd degree black belt" did not feel comfortable using it, he drove me nuts but as you know did not wanna encourage him to much and if he end up hurt and my Judge Judy in my house won't be happy ;-O
customer_reviews.author: GJZ

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Pogo! I had one 20 years ago growing up as a kid and really wanted to test out my Pogo skills again.. This pogo is great! I'm 120lb, 5'4 and it is the perfect size for me. Quality and durability a+
customer_reviews.author: Emma Jade

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product and well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson who I thought was about 120 pounds. Well turns out at 10 he is 140 pounds and I was worried he would be to big or grow out of it to soon. He was unable to get the heavy duty spring to even work. We had a much older and heavier person use it I'm talking 6'2" and at least 180+ pounds. He did manage to get it to work. My review, this is a great product and well made, but make sure the child has the energy to really get it going. "
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Hardeman

customer_reviews.title: It goes super high
customer_reviews.text: We returned it. She is an avid pogo sticker but she went so high on this she fell face first on the pavement on her first try. She went to the ER. She is fine but scary! Needless to say, we sent it back but it cost us a bunch!
customer_reviews.author: Ptownmom9206

customer_reviews.title: good jumper
customer_reviews.text: I do not have much experience on this kind of jumpers, but this one looks good, I tried it and not ez to enjoy it. Because you need a lot of practice. Not for kids younger than 7 maybe, at least my son is 6 does not like it. but should be a good one for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gao

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very sturdy, supports weight from a tween on up to an adult (80 to 160 lbs), very rugged, has a good weight to it Con's: The handle bars have foam around them that seem like it could tear or wear off over time Conclusion: For $37 this is an amazing buy..I see this pogo stick lasting for many years. I was surprised with the quality for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mom3

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for how long it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a 10 year old boy (55lbs). He loved it, gave it non-stop play for a couple weeks but then it totally and completely just fell apart as he was jumping on it. We couldn't get it back together so it ended up going in the trash. Expensive for the little time he got with it.
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: A Nephew's Gift.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 9-year old nephew for Christmas 2019. He LOVES it. His mother is appreciative too because she says she can't get him to do any type of exercise. Now he is exercising and doesn't even realize it. :D
customer_reviews.author: SnowflakeLove

customer_reviews.title: Cutting knees while jumping
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is a defective one we received or because my daughter is short but everytime she jumped, the sides would scratch and cut the inside of her knees. She had several cuts on both knees that made her bleed. She tried wearing jeans but it was still scratching her. We returned and our trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Priya

customer_reviews.title: Years of fun and fitness
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift over a year ago and the recipient still plays on it regularly. It still works well even after being left out in the rain on several occasions. Make sure you get the appropriate size and this can be fun for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.  Tight spring.
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool. Feels fairly sturdy. Spring is very tight for a 9-year-old. The down side is that the plastic piece (with the little guy in the circle, at the top of the spring) came off the first time my 14 year old son was on it. When I attempted to put it back on, it wouldn't snap together. Doesn't really serve a purpose, so it shouldn't matter, but it was disappointing for my 9 year old daughter because she just got it for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Great until it wasn’t. After only 3 months of limited use the plastic piece in the center that covers the spring is cracked. Now I have a very disappointed 10 year old. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Susie M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received this for her birthday and loves it. It is very sturdy and a great value for the price. She has loved learning how to use it for long jumping sessions. I highly highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Weirauch

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 10 year old grandson and he loves it! He was right at the bottom limit for weight but was able to make it work exactly as it was supposed to after we lubricated the stick as directed. He had never jumped on one before but within just a couple of hours, he was bouncing all over the place with it. Good exercise!! Heavy duty and seems like it will last a long time. All you need is a can of silicone spray and it's ready to go..
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, but the wide design...
customer_reviews.text: The wide design gets in the way. Our kid really enjoyed, but outgrew, the single piston design. The double piston design rubs her legs. Maybe she'll grow into it. She's been on it non-stop since she got it tho.
customer_reviews.author: Run Kodoz!

customer_reviews.title: Too fun!!
customer_reviews.text: As I seek to live vicariously through myself, I would say there's no reason why a middle aged woman shouldn't have a pogo stick! It's fun. A great workout. Reminds me to let go and focus on the moment Portable. Goes to the park easy. I keep it in my trunk. This pogo stick functions well. It isn't stiff. (I weigh about 125 lbs). Replacement rubber tips can be purchased when the tip wears out. My neighbors think I'm nuts. I'd say, I'm not afraid to have fun... I would recommend this brand of pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Black.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the future
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the pogo stick but need to mention 1 thing. 80 lbs is the min weight, much lighter and you can't actuate the spring without a lot of work. I guess it will last longer this way but would have been nice to know ahead of time but it may be our fault for not reading description accurately. 1st update: after a solid day of use, our son has mastered the technique and is really enjoying the stick. I agree, with more weight you will get more bounce but this way he will have to master the pogo before going crazy.
customer_reviews.author: AJO

customer_reviews.title: springs too stiff for my 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: well it's my fault- the company says the rider needs to be 80 pounds but i looked at the reviews and many of them said their kids successfully used at as small as 50-60 pounds. Well mine is 65 pounds and she can't get it to really bounce- just not enough weight. Actually i'm not even sure 80 pounds would do it- i am 135 and it was perfect for me so if you have little ones, don't waste your money, go buy a smaller stick. This would be fantastic for a bigger kid. Seemed to be good quality though. i guess i will put it up until she gets bigger.....much bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Bec

customer_reviews.title: good pogo
customer_reviews.text: was a bit hard for my 10 year old son to use at first. but hes gotten the hang of it now. the spring is a bit tighter then what it should be but i feel that it will work out after its been used for a bit
customer_reviews.author: Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: This is a lot of fun for all of us
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of fun for all of us. My 9 year old is only 75 pounds and is not quite heavy enough to work it properly as she doesn't get enough spring. I opted for this higher weight pogo stick knowing that she would grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Cusack

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality plastic parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids and it bounces well however the plastic pedals broke off the first day they used it. Another plastic piece broke off as well.
customer_reviews.author: Swissbailey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and bounces high for a 10 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: For older and heavier person than recommended
customer_reviews.text: The age and weight that is recommended is way off. This is very stiff and hard to use. I am 6'1" 210lbs and its stiff for me. Obviously I can jump with it but saying it's for 90lbs to 160lbs is not true at all
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Pickett

customer_reviews.title: like easily a half mile
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this ALL. THE. TIME. And it bounces SOOOO high! And when I say all the time - I mean - he pogos around the block....like easily a half mile. He pogos on the sidewalk. Off the sidewalk. He pogos for hours. The grips on this one have held up so well for a year of heavy use. And the spring has held up phenomenally well also. I am a huge huge fan of this very well constructed, sturdy pogo. And the color is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine .. so far
customer_reviews.text: The pogo stick is relatively heavy duty (as promised), and it has a good deal of "bounce" for even a grown adult, though there is a plastic sleeve covering the spring that became crumpled and distorted after just a few uses, fresh out of the box. The sleeve is a very cheaply made plastic covering, that appears to serve no useful purpose other than cosmetic (otherwise I would have given a much lower rating). If that sleeve is designed for protection against anything pinching in the main spring, then I'd rate the product quite differently. The plastic sleeve was rendered useless after about 2 minutes worth of basic use. Otherwise a very solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: He loved it! Of course all if the kids had ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas. He loved it! Of course all if the kids had to try it out, even my 6 foot 180 pound grandson. It worked great when all of the kids tried it out. Good Buy. Very Sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For older kids
customer_reviews.text: Got it for a gift for my grandson he weighs 55 pounds-and is 9 it is way too stiff for him to even dump on other than that it’s great thank you would have to weigh about 90 pounds to jump on this
customer_reviews.author: Kathy chipp

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this because a lot of reviews said their child has problems getting it to bounce. My son is 9, weighs 77 lbs, and it bounces just fine. He can't go as high as I can, but it's because I weigh more and the spring is about the amount of weight put on it. If it seems too tight, an adult can use it first to loosen it up a bit. I would definitely recommend this and I'm glad I ended up buying it!
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsin-ite

customer_reviews.title: VERY firm.  For teenager / adult use only.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were right! It is VERY firm. This is an teenager / adult only pogo stick. Bought it for the height, because my daughter is very tall, and didn't want her to grow out of it by next year. But there is zero give when she gets on it, and not even when she tries to bounce on it. It is just too firm.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fry

customer_reviews.title: A decent intro pogo
customer_reviews.text: works well for my 10 year old, but it is not a high quality product. There is a plastic part - fascia - across the top of the spring that keeps falling off; we've just left it aside. And the foam bars will deteriorate quickly with use and sweat. But overall, it is a good starter Pogo Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Adult jump start, frog knees, all good!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT pogo stick for kids and adults alike. TIPS: Have an adult jump on it for the first few rounds as the springs are really really tight & once the springs loosen up, have the kids turn their knees out slightly when they jump. If they face forward, it rubs on the knees so frog it and it's all good. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Argo

customer_reviews.title: Stiff enough to get some good height for an 80 pounder
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Stiff enough to get some good height for an 80 pounder. Much more than that and it might not be stiff enough though. Just depends on how high someone wants to go!
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves this, he was a little short for it, but got use to it and can pogo like a champ. Also was able to accommodate my 15 year old son, is sturdy and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Traci P.

customer_reviews.title: Rubbed legs raw.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product but beware it has points that really rub your knees. Troubleshooting with moleskin taped on it bc legs are raw after 10 minutes of jumping.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine on a fall day

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: The pogo stick is a little stiff, but my 10 year old son, who weighs about 70 pounds can get 4-5 inches off the ground. He really enjoys. Very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Red Montana

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too big and visible
customer_reviews.text: Came completely visible in box. Hard to jump on but worth the price! A bit big for a tall 10 year old so it will definitely last us a while. Comfortable grip. I assume it is meant for ages 10 and up because of the size. Okay for the indoors, but not great. A bit wobbly for younger users, but an eighteen year old could be fine. Get this when you are 12 and will last until you are 52. Nice color. Although I am warning you, not the best holiday gift. I think its supposed to say in the description. This may have changed since December 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Jane B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice outside toy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy built. My son is 13 weighs about 115 and works great for him. I couldn't get the decorative logo clip to stay on but that didn't matter to me.
customer_reviews.author: PrairieGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this pogo stick! He's 8 years old, about 4'10" and 80 lbs. He is able to get a good bounce on cement and enjoys the challenge. I like that it is more sturdy because he's rough with his things. Overall we are very happy with this purchase and would buy another if we needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Guzman

customer_reviews.title: We love it he's just under weight!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson who turned 7. However because he's a light weight it will be some time before he could use it. I accidentally threw away the box and now I must keep it. It is as explained but since I did not pay attention to the age/weight requirement I just have to be patient. However, it would be great if the seller sees my comment and decides to feel sympathy and allow me to exchange it for the age/weight appropriate for a 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Beautymole

customer_reviews.title: It's Fun! It's funny watching others for the first time jumping! Did I mention fun?😁
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to pogo at first..........But once you get the hang if it, it's so fun and for any age! We laughed so hard. It's great exercise too! Gets your heart rate up, legs moving and a arm workout. So fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Flybar Foam Master Pogo Stick For Kids Boys & Girls Ages 9 & Up, 80 to 160 Lbs - Fun Quality Pogostick By The Original Pogo Stick Company
product_meta.description:
From the makers of the high flying Flybar, the Flybar Foam Master Pogo Stick is a modern design adaptation of the classic toy. It's sure to promote healthy and exciting fun for boys and girls of all ages. A great introduction to pogo stick jumping--perfect for the beginner and for intermediate riders--it's ideal for jumpers aged 9 years and older. It features a rugged metal frame covered in precision-made foam, replaceable non-slip foot pads, easy-grip handles, and a rubber tip to help you stay in control. As a safety precaution, it is recommended to always use a helmet.

AMAZON.COM
From the makers of the high flying Flybar, the Flybar Foam Master Pogo Stick is a modern design adaptation of the classic toy. It's sure to promote healthy and exciting fun for boys and girls of all ages. A great introduction to pogo stick jumping--perfect for the beginner and for intermediate riders--it's ideal for jumpers aged 9 years and older. It features a rugged metal frame covered in precision-made foam, replaceable non-slip foot pads, easy-grip handles, and a rubber tip to help you stay in control. As a safety precaution, it is recommended to always use a helmet. 

 



Fun, exciting way to get exercise. 

Get some air and show your tricks.
feature_bullets: THE ORIGINAL POGO STICK COMPANY- Flybar has been in business since 1918 and continues to be "the standard by which all pogos are measured." You can be assured that everything we make is the best of the best.
FOAM COVERED GRIPS AND FRAME: We covered our Master Pogo Stick in foam not only for a comfortable cushion grip, but to keep your pogo looking great.
WIDER STANCE BOUNCE TIP: Not only do we want you to have fun, but we want you to be safe. The wider tip provides a more stable and consistent pogoing experience.
SHOW OFF YOUR TRICKS: Flybar’s Master Pogostick features stable, non-slip foot pegs to help riders do tricks with ease.
The Flybar Foam Master Pogo Stick is meant for kids ages 9 and up, and is able to handle weights from 80-160 pounds.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
